intro: Nepeta latifolia var. controversa, commonly known as catmint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It features aromatic, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular blue or purple flowers. The plant is characterized by its dense, low-growing habit and is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Nepeta latifolia var. controversa is also valued for its historical use in herbal medicine and as a source of cat attractant.
